WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi,

We are closing this work item, as this is probably not an issue in Prism and the problem described by the user has been solved. For additional support regarding this subject, you could create a thread in the discussion section, where we will help you with any doubt you might have.

Regards,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini
WorkItem.Description:
HI all,
 
I have been trying to place smf player (http://smf.codeplex.com/releases/view/76103) into prism container but fail.
 
So the module is to load smf player into one of prism region, it shows but can't play the video.
Under the view of the module, I just place:
 
<smf:SMFPlayer>
            <smf:SMFPlayer.Playlist>
                <media:PlaylistItem DeliveryMethod="AdaptiveStreaming" MediaSource="http://video3.smoothhd.com.edgesuite.net/ondemand/Big%20Buck%20Bunny%20Adaptive.ism/Manifest"/>
            </smf:SMFPlayer.Playlist>
        </smf:SMFPlayer>
 
The player is shown but can't play. Any idea how to fix this?
 
Thanks

Comments.Message:
Hi,

You could try adding references to the custom SMF Player libraries in your shell project as well; that might be causing your problems when using it.

Other than that, in my opinion Prism shouldn't be causing trouble when using a component such as the SMF player. If the aforementioned suggestion doesn't help you solve your problem, you could try placing your control directly in the shell; that could give us additional hints on why the problem is happening.

I hope you find this helpful.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi

Hi Guido,

Thank you for your help and here is what I did and the result
1. I did add references to SMF Player Libraries (the following files - Window 7) to shell project
C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Microsoft Silverlight Media Framework\v2.6\Silverlight\Bin\Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.dll
C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Microsoft Silverlight Media Framework\v2.6\Silverlight\Bin\Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.dll
C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Microsoft Silverlight Media Framework\v2.6\Silverlight\Bin\Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Plugins.SmoothStreaming.dll
C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\Microsoft Silverlight Media Framework\v2.6\Silverlight\Bin\Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Utilities.dll
C:\Program Files\Microsoft SDKs\IIS Smooth Streaming Client\v1.5\Silverlight\Microsoft.Web.Media.SmoothStreaming.dll

I then rebuild and run it, the SMF player is shown but can't play. I press play button, nothing happen.

2. I continue with the second options of your instruction, I then just add the SMF control directly to "TopLeftRegion" of the Shell as:

...

...

     
             
                
                    
                
            
     
...
 



I then re-compile and run it, the result is the same, SMF player is shown but can't play even pressing the play button.

P/S: the shell project I created is an Prism Silverlight 4.0 Shell (Unity).

I attached the result image also.

Thank you so much for looking into this Guido.

Hi,

Thank you for the additional details. Have you tried adding the SMF Player in a similar Silverlight application that doesn't use Prism? That would be helpful for us to know if the problem is caused by Prism.

If, after running this test, you determine that the problem is caused by Prism, it would be helpful if you could provide us with a repro sample application so that we can help you further with this.

Thanks,

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi

Hi,

As mentioned in the comment below, the scenario mentioned in this work item does not refer to a Prism issue or suggestion.

Therefore, I'm closing this work item. For further support on the subject, you could create a thread in the discussions section (http://compositewpf.codeplex.com/discussions).

Thanks,

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi


** Closed by GuidoMaliandi 11/30/2011 4:54 AM

Hi, 

Please disregard the last comment about closing the work item, as it was not intended for this work item.

Sorry for the inconveniences. Let us know when you have the results of trying out tje SMF player under similar  conditions but without Prism.

Thanks,

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi

Hi Guido,

Thank for looking into this.

I did the same code in simple silverlight and it works like charm. See the attached code. I will attached the same code but place directly in Prism Shell in the next comment since it exceeds the upload limit (4MB).

Truyen

Hi Truyen,

So far we could not reproduce the behavior you are describing. I modified the Silverlight sample you attached to include the Prism library, moved the SMF player to a module and the SMF player worked correctly.

Attached to this work item you can find the modified sample with the name SMFSampleWithPrism.zip. You might find useful to check this sample and find any differences with your application.

Regards,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini

Thank DCherubini,

I just look at your code and couldn't fine much diffirent. The explicit different I see in your code is that you don't add SMFModule module into SMF.Web as an Application (Right Click into SMF.Web -> properties -> Silverlight Applications). Here you only have SMF not the SMFModule. While I do, I use the Prism Template to create both the Shell and then the SMFModule, then I have to add to SMF and SMFModule in the SMF.Web.

Did you have my Silverlight example without modification working on yours?
Thanks

Hi Truyen,

I downloaded your silverlight-only sample (SMF.rar) and it worked correctly without modifications. Also, I built the Prism sample (SMFSampleWithPrism.zip) based on your silverlight sample. Those are the steps that I followed to include Prism in the sample: 
 - I created a "Silverlight Class Library" to use as the SMFModule, 
 - included the required libraries to use the "Silverlight Media Framework" and the Prism library, 
 - added the SMFModule.cs class by hand, 
 - moved the MainPage.xaml view to the module manually, 
 - included a reference to the SMFModule in the SMF project, 
 - etc.

I hope you find this useful,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini

Thank, that's work on my end.

Truyen Le

That works on my end. Thanks you so much.

Truyen
